soc_scenario.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period (e.g. observed changes in historical land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-1901 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please only label your model run `1901soc` if it does not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-1901 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings. This scenario may be thought of an approximation of pre-industrial levels of human impacts.

soc_scenario.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
soc_scenario.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-2015 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3a simulation round
simulation_round.description: Historical model evaluation and attribution runs

simulation_round.title: ISIMIP3b simulation round
simulation_round.description: GCM-based simulations assuming fixed 2015 direct human influences for the future

bias_adjustment.description: Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).
Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.

sens_scenario.description: For all experiments other than the sensitivity experiments.
CO₂ concentration fixed at 1901 levels as a deviation from the “obsclim” climate + CO₂ forcing.

forest_stand.title: Hyytiälä
forest_stand.comment: Note that an experimental plot of pine contains a lot of data while footprint of flux tower is larger. Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

forest_stand.title: Peitz
forest_stand.comment: Managed using a weak thinning from below.

forest_stand.title: Kranzberg Roof Project
forest_stand.comment: Unmanaged/ thinning from below in past 20 years for all species.

climate_scenario.description: Observed climate and CO₂ forcing used for model evaluation and the detection and attribution task.

Detrended version of the observed climate related forcing used for the "no climate change" baseline simulations for impact attribution. Keep CO₂ and CH₄ concentrations at 1901 values ([CO₂] = 296.13 ppm; [CH₄] = 928.8004 ppb). Keep the same lightening data as in obsclim.

climate_variable.comment: Source: Meinshausen et al. (2011, <https://doi.org/10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z>) for 1850-2005 and Dlugokencky & Tans (2019, <https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/>) from 2006-2019.
Source: Malte Meinshausen et al. (2016, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-2016-169> for 1850-2014 and Ed Dlugokencky (NOAA/GML, <https://gml.noaa.gov/ccgg/trends_ch4/>) for 2015-2019

harmonization.title: Default
harmonization.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

harmonization.title: Fully harmonized
harmonization.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmonization.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmonization.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated. Please contact the sector coordination to push on with this side branch.

geo_dataset.comment: This is the land-sea mask of the W5E5 dataset (Cucchi et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-2097-2020>; Lange et al., 2021, <https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.342217>). Over all grid cells marked as land by this mask, all climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. For further information see also <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/41/>.

This is the generic land-sea mask from ISIMIP2b that is to be used for global water simulations in ISIMIP3. It marks more grid cells as land than **landseamask**. Over those additional land cells, the climate data that are based on W5E5 (GSWP3-W5E5 as well as climate data bias-adjusted using W5E5) are not guaranteed to represent climate conditions over land. Instead they may represent climate conditions over sea or a mix of conditions over land and sea.
Country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.
Fractional country masks from the ISIpedia project. More formats are available at <https://github.com/ISI-MIP/isipedia-countries>.

One fixed pattern to be used for all simulation periods. Upscaled Soil texture map (30 arc sec. to 0.5°x0.5° grid) based on Harmonized World Soil Database v1.1 (HWSD, <https://www.fao.org/publications/card/en/c/2fa14e5e-ae97-516e-9dd2-24bc7abbc823/>) using the GSWP3 upscaling method A (<http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~sujan/research/gswp3/soil-texture-map.html>)

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

geo_dataset.comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on all land.

variables.long_name: USDA soil texture class dominant HWSD on cropland (texture_class)
domiant HWSD soil mapping unit within dominant USDA soil texture class on cropland (mu_global)

geo_dataset.comment: GGCMI Phase 3 soil input data set for usage in ISIMIP/GGCMI Phase 3 simulations, data aggregated by dominant soil profile (MU_GLOBAL) within dominant soil texture class from HWSD on current cropland (MIRCA2000 at 5 arc-minutes, <https://doi.org/10.1029/2008GB003435>).

geo_dataset.title: basins
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002, <https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0>). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

geo_dataset.title: flowdir
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002, <https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0>). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

geo_dataset.title: slopes
geo_dataset.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002, <https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-1694(01)00565-0>). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

climate_forcing.title: GSWP3-W5E5
climate_forcing.comments: Combination of W5E5 v2.0 (Cucchi et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-2020-28>, and Lange et al., 2021, <https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.342217>) for 1979-2019 with GSWP3 v1.09 (Kim, 2017, <https://doi.org/10.20783/DIAS.501>) homogenized to W5E5 for 1901-1978. The homogenization reduces discontinuities at the 1978/1979 transition and was done using the ISIMIP3BASD v2.5.0 bias adjustment method (Lange, 2019, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-12-3055-2019> and Lange, 2021, <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4686991>). For further information see also <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/80/>

climate_forcing.title: 20CRv3-W5E5
climate_forcing.comments: Combination of W5E5 v2.0 for 1979-2019 with 20CRv3 (ensemble member 1) homogenized to W5E5 for 1901-1978. The homogenization was done in the same way as for GSWP3-W5E5.

climate_forcing.title: 20CRv3-ERA5
climate_forcing.comments: Combination of ERA5 for 1979-2021 with 20CRv3 (ensemble member 1) homogenized to ERA5 for 1901-1978. The homogenization was done in the same way as for GSWP3-W5E5.

climate_forcing.title: 20CRv3
climate_forcing.comments: Ensemble member 1 of NOAA-CIRES-DOE 20th Century Reanalysis version 3 (Slivinski et al., 2019, <https://doi.org/10.1002/qj.3598> and Compo et al., 2011, <https://doi.org/10.1002/qj.776>) interpolated to 0.5° spatial resolution.

dimensions.long_name: Depth of Vertical Layer Center Below Surface

product.title: Input Data
product.description: The data used to drive the impact models, exactly as described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Input Data
product.description: Data that have been derived from or are related to the input data, but not described in the simulation protocol (e.g. with a differnt spatial or temporal resolution).

product.title: Output Data
product.description: The climate-impacts simulation data provided by participating modelling groups, corresponding to the output variables described in the ISIMIP simulation protocol.

product.title: Secondary Output Data
product.description: Data that have been derived by processing the ISIMIP output data, but do not correspond to output variables described in the simulation protocol.

variable.comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.
variable.long_name: Total Runoff

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.
variable.long_name: Surface Runoff

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.
variable.long_name: Subsurface Runoff

variable.comment: River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.
variable.long_name: Discharge

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.
variable.long_name: Evapotranspiration

variable.comment: As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.
variable.long_name: Potential Evapotranspiration

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

variable.comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Total Soil Moisture Content

variable.comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Frozen Soil Moisture Content

variable.comment: Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Temperature of Soil

variable.comment: Grid cell mean depth of snowpack.
variable.long_name: Snow depth

variable.comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell.
variable.long_name: Snow Water Equivalent

variable.comment: Mean monthly water storage in all compartments. Please indicate in the netcdf metadata which storage compartments are considered.
variable.long_name: Total Water Storage

variable.comment: Calculated from daily thaw depths.
variable.long_name: Annual Maximum Thaw Depth

variable.comment: Soil type as used by your model. Please include a description of each type in the model documentation (under "Other data sets used"). Please also include a link to a database/paper describing the parameters and values associated with these soil types.
variable.long_name: Soil Types

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation

variable.comment: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Vegetation Biomass

variable.comment: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass

variable.comment: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

variable.comment: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

variable.comment: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, csoil separated by pools can additionally be provided. Please indicate them as fast, slow, and passive. Please describe your definition of the turnover times in your model description.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool

variable.comment: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, csoil separated by pools can additionally be provided. Please indicate them as fast, slow, and passive. Please describe your definition of the turnover times in your model description. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool in each layer

variable.comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
variable.long_name: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (plant) Respiration on Land

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land

variable.comment: Total C emitted from all fires (including deforestation and peat fire C emission).
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to C Emission from Fire

variable.comment: Total area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time (including peat and deforestation fires).
variable.long_name: Burnt Area Fraction

variable.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land

variable.comment: For wood products only. Sum of carbon fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emissions from previous years.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Land Use Change

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Grazing

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Crop Harvesting

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation to Litter

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil

variable.comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “flittersoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil in each layer

variable.comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

variable.comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “fvegsoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil in each layer

variable.comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.
variable.long_name: Leaf Area Index

variable.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.
variable.long_name: Plant Functional Type Grid Fraction

variable.comment: The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
variable.long_name: Evaporation from Canopy (interception)

variable.comment: Includes sublimation.
variable.long_name: Water Evaporation from Soil
Transpiration
Carbon Mass in Leaves

variable.comment: Including sapwood and hardwood.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Wood

variable.comment: Including fine and coarse roots.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass in Roots
Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris

variable.comment: Grid cell total
variable.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

variable.comment: Grid cell total
variable.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

variable.comment: Soil nitrogen excluding belowground litter if your model reports nlitterbg. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report nsoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil nitrogen for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil nitrogen integrated over the entire soil depth. If your model simulates different pools of different turnover times, nsoil separated by pools can additionally be provided. Please indicate them as fast, slow, and passive and describe your definition of the turnover times in your model description. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Soil

variable.comment: Albedo of the land surface interacting with the atmosphere. Average of pfts, snow cover, bare ground.
variable.long_name: Surface Albedo of Land
Dissolved Organic Carbon
variable.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

variable.comment: Net upward flux of methane from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
variable.long_name: Grid averaged methane emissions from wetland

variable.comment: If possible, provide CH₄ emissions for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Total Surface Carbon Mass Flux into CH₄ emissions

variable.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.
variable.frequency: monthly, else annual (or fixed if static)
variable.long_name: Wetland Fraction

variable.comment: If possible, provide soil respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, rsoillayer separated by pools can additionally be provided. Please indicate them as fast, slow, and passive and describe your definition of the turnover times in your model description. If you do not report layers, the depth dimension is 1. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land of pools with different turnover time in each layer

variable.comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Vertical Carbon Mass Flux between layers

variable.comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Litter Respiration on Land in each layer

variable.comment: Grid cell total.
variable.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation

variable.comment: Grid cell total.
variable.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above Ground Vegetation Biomass

variable.comment: Grid cell total.
variable.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass

variable.comment: Can be split into nMineralNH4, mineral ammonium in the soil and nMineralNO3 mineral nitrate in the soil. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Mineral Nitrogen in the soil

variable.comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed nitrogen should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation on the ISIMIP homepage.
variable.long_name: Nitrogen in Products of Land Use Change

variable.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire.
variable.long_name: Total Nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (including NHx, N2O, N2) from fire

variable.comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
variable.long_name: Total nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

variable.comment: Leaching means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil.
variable.long_name: Total nitrogen loss due to leaching or runoff (sum of ammonium, nitrite and nitrate)

variable.comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area.
variable.long_name: Total nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure)
Total nitrogen lost (including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and leaching)
Nitrogen in deforested or harvested biomass as a result of anthropogenic land-use or change
Nitrogen mass flux out of land due to any human activity
Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation to litter
Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation directly to soil
Total nitrogen mass flux from litter to soil

variable.comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.
variable.long_name: Biological nitrogen fixation

variable.comment: Surface upward flux of ammonia (NH3) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.
variable.long_name: Total land NH3 flux

variable.comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.
variable.long_name: Total land N2O flux

variable.comment: Surface deposition rate of nitrogen.
variable.long_name: Dry and wet deposition of reactive nitrogen onto land

variable.comment: If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Net nitrogen release from soil and litter as the outcome of nitrogen immobilisation and gross mineralisation

variable.comment: If possible, provide heterotrophic respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide heterotrophic respiration integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land in each layer

variable.comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
variable.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Bioenergy Harvesting

soc_dataset.title: Landuse totals

variables.long_name: share of managed pastures or rangeland

soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016, <https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017>), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020>, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information on the land use data refer to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/82/>.

soc_dataset.title: Downscaling to 5 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated C4 annual crops
share of rainfed C4 annual crops
share of irrigated C3 perennial crops
share of rainfed C3 perennial crops
share of irrigated C3 N-fixing crops
share of rainfed C3 N-fixing crops
share of irrigated C4 annual crops
share of rainfed C4 annual crops
share of irrigated C4 perennial crops
share of rainfed C4 perennial crops

soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016, <https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017>), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020>, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Downscaling to 15 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated Oil crops groundnut
share of rainfed Oil crops groundnut
share of irrigated Oil crops rapeseed
share of rainfed Oil crops rapeseed

soc_dataset.comment: The C4 perennial crops are not further downscaled from the "5 crops" data set and currently only include sugarcane.  Similarly, the C3 perennial crops are not downscaled either. The data is derived from the "5 crops" LUH2 data, and the crops have been downscaled to 15 crops according to the ratios given by the Monfreda data set (Monfreda, Ramankutty, and Foley, 2008, <https://doi.org/10.1029/2007GB002947>).

soc_dataset.title: Managed pastures and rangeland
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016, <https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017>), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020>, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Urban areas
soc_dataset.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016, <https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017>), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020>, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

soc_dataset.title: Nitrogen deposited by fertilizers on croplands

variables.long_name: N input through fertilizer on cropland with C3 annual crops

soc_dataset.comment: Based on the LUH2 v2h data set (see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020>, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/28/>.

soc_dataset.title: Reduced nitrogen deposition
soc_dataset.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 (Tian et al., 2018, <https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1>). Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. Data for 2015-2019 is assumed to be same as that in 2014. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

soc_dataset.title: Oxidized nitrogen deposition
soc_dataset.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 (Tian et al., 2018, <https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1>). Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. Data for 2015-2019 is assumed to be same as that in 2014 . For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

soc_dataset.title: Reservoirs & dams

variables.long_name: Unique ID representing a dam and its associated reservoir corresponding to GRanD/KSU IDs
Original longitudinal location of the dam
variables.specifier: Original latitudinal location of the dam

variables.long_name: Longitude, adjusted to the DDM30 0.5° grid cell centers
Latitude, adjusted to 0.5° grid cell centers
Upstream area draining into the reservoir using DDM30
Upstream area draining into the reservoir acc. to GRanD
Representative maximum storage capacity of reservoir [10⁶ m³]
Year of construction, completion, commissioning, etc.
Flag to indicate that the year of dam construction has been artificially set to 1850 if not existing
Altern. year: may indicate multi-year construction, secondary dam, etc.
Flag of correction if relocation was applied
Name of the river which the dam impounds
Country where the dam is located
Height of the dam. If multiple  heights are available, the foundation height was used.
Maximum inundation area of the reservoir
Sources used to collect this dam’s information

soc_dataset.comment: Lehner et al. (2011a, <https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK>), Lehner et al. (2011b, <https://dx.doi.org/10.1890/100125>), and Jida Wang et al. (KSU/Kansas State University, personal communication, data starting in 2016). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications. Please contact <info@isimip.org> in case of questions.

soc_dataset.title: Water abstraction for domestic and industrial purposes
soc_dataset.comment: For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08. This data is based ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project (Wada et al., 2016, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-175-2016>) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

soc_dataset.title: Wood harvesting

variables.long_name: wood harvest area from primary forest land
wood harvest area from primary non forest land
wood harvest area from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest area from secondary young forest land
wood harvest area from secondary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary young forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary non forest land

soc_dataset.comment: Historic annual country-level wood harvesting data. Based on the LUH2 v2h Harmonization Data Set (Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020, <https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020>, see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). Interpolated to a 0.5° grid using first-order conservative remapping and calculated over a fractional country mask (<https://gitlab.pik-potsdam.de/isipedia/countrymasks/-/blob/master/>) derived from ASAP-GAUL (<https://data.europa.eu/euodp/data/dataset/jrc-10112-10004>). For further information see <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/83/>

soc_dataset.title: Population

variables.long_name: total number of people per country

soc_dataset.comment: Historical population data are based on the 2019 Revision of the United Nations World Population Prospects (United Nations, 2019, <https://population.un.org/wpp/>). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset (Arujo et al., 2021, <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504>).

soc_dataset.title: GDP
soc_dataset.comment: Historic country-level GDP data are based on GDP per capita estimates from the WDI (1965-2020). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset (Arujo et al., 2021, <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504>).
